definition: to apologize humbly/to beg forgiveness
to ask/to invite/please (do sth)/to treat (to a meal etc)/to request
variant of 罪[zui4], crime
guilt/crime/fault/blame/sin
lit. to bring a bramble and ask for punishment (idiom)/fig. to offer sb a humble apology

sentences.english: Can also personally go to friend home" to offer a humble apology".
sentences.chinese: 也可以亲自去朋友家“负荆请罪”。

sentences.english: Alarm, the guards down to the ground, again and again a misunderstanding.
sentences.chinese: 惊恐之下，卫兵扑倒在地，连连请罪。

sentences.english: Or do you want my this open prince to bend down to come to query for apologize to you?
sentences.chinese: 还是你要我这个堂堂太子跪下来向你请罪？

definition: to confess one's fault/to accept one's punishment
to apologize for an offense/to offer one's apology for a fault
to apologize
to apologize/apology
to denounce/to condemn/to call to account/to punish
to offer an apology/to make amends
to kneel down
to kowtow (traditional greeting, esp. to a superior, involving kneeling and pressing one's forehead to the ground)/also written 磕頭|磕头[ke1 tou2]
to thank sb for favor (esp. emperor or superior official)
to plea for leniency/to ask for a favor
to report (to one's superior)
lit. to bring a bramble and ask for punishment (idiom)/fig. to offer sb a humble apology
to report on completion of a mission/debriefing
to have an audience (with the emperor)
to punish
to kowtow/also written 磕頭|磕头[ke1 tou2]
